summary: This document appears to be an email or communication from March 5, 2024, providing links to two ongoing investigations: a Senate Finance Committee investigation into Leon Black's tax planning and financial ties with Jeffrey Epstein, and a Dechert internal investigation report filed with the SEC. It highlights continued scrutiny of financial connections in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Named as a private billionaire whose tax planning and financial ties with Jeffrey Epstein are under investigation by the Senate Finance Committee.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased financier and convicted sex offender
persons.context: Referenced for his financial ties with Leon Black, which are part of the Senate Finance Committee investigation.

connections.description: The Senate Finance Committee is investigating Leon Black's tax planning and financial ties with Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Email referencing ongoing investigations
events.description: An email dated March 5, 2024, provides links to a Senate Finance Committee investigation into Leon Black's ties with Jeffrey Epstein and a Dechert internal investigation report.

keyFacts: The Senate Finance Committee, led by Senator Wyden, has an ongoing investigation into billionaire Leon Black's tax planning and financial ties with Jeffrey Epstein.
A Dechert internal investigation report is referenced, likely related to financial or legal matters connected to the Epstein case.
The communication date of March 5, 2024, indicates that investigations into Epstein's financial network were still active years after his death.
